page.title: 20ODSTOCK GIPSY SITE,SALISBURY
page.content: New purpose-built,landscaped site built by the County Council, maintained by District Council.Situated on ridge just N.of Odstock Hospital.Road access from Salisbury-Odstock road into concealed hollow.3 cul-de-sacs provide 12,8,10 pitches.Each cul-de-sac has a building with day-room,bath,toilet,electricity &water outlets.Eacy pitch wide enough for lorry-caravan,car,&small garden.20 transit pitches fir gypsies travelling thro'town.Purpose to provide permanent site with basic facilities,privacy, some means of creating identity in open country,but not far from the town.Salisbury district is now adesignated area,temporary camping being allowed only on the transit pitches.
